intro: Wyethia scabra var. attenuata, commonly known as the slender wyethia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat head. This variety is distinguished by its slender stem and reduced leaf size compared to the typical form of Wyethia scabra.
